lines.text: Enter LEONTES, ANTIGONUS, Lords, and Servants

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: Nor night nor day no rest: it is but weakness To bear the matter thus mere weakness. If The cause were not in being,part o the cause, She the adulteress for the harlot king Is quite beyond mine arm, out of the blank And level of my brain, plotproof but she I can hook to me: say that she were gone, Given to the fire, a moiety of my rest Might come to me again. Whos there

lines.speaker: first servant
lines.text: My lord

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: How does the boy

lines.speaker: first servant
lines.text: He took good rest tonight Tis hoped his sickness is discharged.

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: To see his nobleness! Conceiving the dishonour of his mother, He straight declined, droopd, took it deeply, Fastend and fixd the shame ont in himself, Threw off his spirit, his appetite, his sleep, And downright languishd. Leave me solely: go, See how he fares. Fie, fie! no thought of him: The thought of my revenges that way Recoil upon me: in himself too mighty, And in his parties, his alliance let him be Until a time may serve: for present vengeance, Take it on her. Camillo and Polixenes Laugh at me, make their pastime at my sorrow: They should not laugh if I could reach them, nor Shall she within my power.
Exit Servant
Enter PAULINA, with a child

lines.speaker: first lord
lines.text: You must not enter.

lines.speaker: paulina
lines.text: Nay, rather, good my lords, be second to me: Fear you his tyrannous passion more, alas, Than the queens life a gracious innocent soul, More free than he is jealous.

lines.speaker: antigonus
lines.text: Thats enough.

lines.speaker: second servant
lines.text: Madam, he hath not slept tonight commanded None should come at him.

lines.speaker: paulina
lines.text: Not so hot, good sir: I come to bring him sleep. Tis such as you, That creep like shadows by him and do sigh At each his needless heavings, such as you Nourish the cause of his awaking: I Do come with words as medicinal as true, Honest as either, to purge him of that humour That presses him from sleep.

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: What noise there, ho

lines.speaker: paulina
lines.text: No noise, my lord but needful conference About some gossips for your highness.

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: How! Away with that audacious lady! Antigonus, I charged thee that she should not come about me: I knew she would.

lines.speaker: antigonus
lines.text: I told her so, my lord, On your displeasures peril and on mine, She should not visit you.

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: What, canst not rule her

lines.speaker: paulina
lines.text: From all dishonesty he can: in this, Unless he take the course that you have done, Commit me for committing honour, trust it, He shall not rule me.

lines.speaker: antigonus
lines.text: La you now, you hear: When she will take the rein I let her run But shell not stumble.

lines.speaker: paulina
lines.text: Good my liege, I come And, I beseech you, hear me, who profess Myself your loyal servant, your physician, Your most obedient counsellor, yet that dare Less appear so in comforting your evils, Than such as most seem yours: I say, I come From your good queen.

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: Good queen!

lines.speaker: paulina
lines.text: Good queen, my lord, Good queen I say good queen And would by combat make her good, so were I A man, the worst about you.

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: Force her hence.

lines.speaker: paulina
lines.text: Let him that makes but trifles of his eyes First hand me: on mine own accord Ill off But first Ill do my errand. The good queen, For she is good, hath brought you forth a daughter Here tis commends it to your blessing.
Laying down the child

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: Out! A mankind witch! Hence with her, out o door: A most intelligencing bawd!

lines.speaker: paulina
lines.text: Not so: I am as ignorant in that as you In so entitling me, and no less honest Than you are mad which is enough, Ill warrant, As this world goes, to pass for honest.

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: Traitors! Will you not push her out Give her the bastard. Thou dotard! thou art womantired, unroosted By thy dame Partlet here. Take up the bastard Taket up, I say givet to thy crone.

lines.speaker: paulina
lines.text: For ever Unvenerable be thy hands, if thou Takest up the princess by that forced baseness Which he has put upont!

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: He dreads his wife.

lines.speaker: paulina
lines.text: So I would you did then twere past all doubt Yould call your children yours.

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: A nest of traitors!

lines.speaker: antigonus
lines.text: I am none, by this good light.

lines.speaker: paulina
lines.text: Nor I, nor any But one thats here, and thats himself, for he The sacred honour of himself, his queens, His hopeful sons, his babes, betrays to slander, Whose sting is sharper than the swords and will not For, as the case now stands, it is a curse He cannot be compelld totonce remove The root of his opinion, which is rotten As ever oak or stone was sound.

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: A callat Of boundless tongue, who late hath beat her husband And now baits me! This brat is none of mine It is the issue of Polixenes: Hence with it, and together with the dam Commit them to the fire!

lines.speaker: paulina
lines.text: It is yours And, might we lay the old proverb to your charge, So like you, tis the worse. Behold, my lords, Although the print be little, the whole matter And copy of the father, eye, nose, lip, The trick ofs frown, his forehead, nay, the valley, The pretty dimples of his chin and cheek, His smiles, The very mould and frame of hand, nail, finger: And thou, good goddess Nature, which hast made it So like to him that got it, if thou hast The ordering of the mind too, mongst all colours No yellow int, lest she suspect, as he does, Her children not her husbands!

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: A gross hag And, lozel, thou art worthy to be hangd, That wilt not stay her tongue.

lines.speaker: antigonus
lines.text: Hang all the husbands That cannot do that feat, youll leave yourself Hardly one subject.

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: Once more, take her hence.

lines.speaker: paulina
lines.text: A most unworthy and unnatural lord Can do no more.

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: Ill ha thee burnt.

lines.speaker: paulina
lines.text: I care not: It is an heretic that makes the fire, Not she which burns int. Ill not call you tyrant But this most cruel usage of your queen, Not able to produce more accusation Than your own weakhinged fancy, something savours Of tyranny and will ignoble make you, Yea, scandalous to the world.

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: On your allegiance, Out of the chamber with her! Were I a tyrant, Where were her life she durst not call me so, If she did know me one. Away with her!

lines.speaker: paulina
lines.text: I pray you, do not push me Ill be gone. Look to your babe, my lord tis yours: Jove send her A better guiding spirit! What needs these hands You, that are thus so tender oer his follies, Will never do him good, not one of you. So, so: farewell we are gone.
Exit

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: Thou, traitor, hast set on thy wife to this. My child away witht! Even thou, that hast A heart so tender oer it, take it hence And see it instantly consumed with fire Even thou and none but thou. Take it up straight: Within this hour bring me word tis done, And by good testimony, or Ill seize thy life, With what thou else callst thine. If thou refuse And wilt encounter with my wrath, say so The bastard brains with these my proper hands Shall I dash out. Go, take it to the fire For thou setst on thy wife.

lines.speaker: antigonus
lines.text: I did not, sir: These lords, my noble fellows, if they please, Can clear me int.

lines.speaker: lords
lines.text: We can: my royal liege, He is not guilty of her coming hither.

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: Youre liars all.

lines.speaker: first lord
lines.text: Beseech your highness, give us better credit: We have always truly served you, and beseech you So to esteem of us, and on our knees we beg, As recompense of our dear services Past and to come, that you do change this purpose, Which being so horrible, so bloody, must Lead on to some foul issue: we all kneel.

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: I am a feather for each wind that blows: Shall I live on to see this bastard kneel And call me father better burn it now Than curse it then. But be it let it live. It shall not neither. You, sir, come you hither You that have been so tenderly officious With Lady Margery, your midwife there, To save this bastards life,for tis a bastard, So sure as this beards grey, what will you adventure To save this brats life

lines.speaker: antigonus
lines.text: Any thing, my lord, That my ability may undergo And nobleness impose: at least thus much: Ill pawn the little blood which I have left To save the innocent: any thing possible.

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: It shall be possible. Swear by this sword Thou wilt perform my bidding.

lines.speaker: antigonus
lines.text: I will, my lord.

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: Mark and perform it, seest thou! for the fail Of any point int shall not only be Death to thyself but to thy lewdtongued wife, Whom for this time we pardon. We enjoin thee, As thou art liegeman to us, that thou carry This female bastard hence and that thou bear it To some remote and desert place quite out Of our dominions, and that there thou leave it, Without more mercy, to its own protection And favour of the climate. As by strange fortune It came to us, I do in justice charge thee, On thy souls peril and thy bodys torture, That thou commend it strangely to some place Where chance may nurse or end it. Take it up.

lines.speaker: antigonus
lines.text: I swear to do this, though a present death Had been more merciful. Come on, poor babe: Some powerful spirit instruct the kites and ravens To be thy nurses! Wolves and bears, they say Casting their savageness aside have done Like offices of pity. Sir, be prosperous In more than this deed does require! And blessing Against this cruelty fight on thy side, Poor thing, condemnd to loss!
Exit with the child

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: No, Ill not rear Anothers issue.
Enter a Servant

lines.speaker: servant
lines.text: Please your highness, posts From those you sent to the oracle are come An hour since: Cleomenes and Dion, Being well arrived from Delphos, are both landed, Hasting to the court.

lines.speaker: first lord
lines.text: So please you, sir, their speed Hath been beyond account.

lines.speaker: leontes
lines.text: Twentythree days They have been absent: tis good speed foretells The great Apollo suddenly will have The truth of this appear. Prepare you, lords Summon a session, that we may arraign Our most disloyal lady, for, as she hath Been publicly accused, so shall she have A just and open trial. While she lives My heart will be a burthen to me. Leave me, And think upon my bidding.
Exeunt
